SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT515
SwiftMessageFormat.DescriptiveName: Client Confirmation of Purchase or Sale
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message is sent by an executing party, eg, a broker-dealer, to an instructing party, eg, a client, or its authorised representative.
This message is used to confirm the details of a purchase or sale executed by the executing party on behalf of the instructing party. It is also used to provide details on the payment side of the transaction.
It may also be used to: a) request the cancellation of a previously sent client confirmation b) re-send a client confirmation previously sent c) provide a third party with a copy of the message (be it the confirmation or request for cancellation) being sent.
Where legally accepted, this message serves as an electronic contract note which is legally binding on both parties.
Where a block trade has been executed and allocation instructions provided, one client confirmation must be sent per allocation.
This message may be sent directly or via an ETC service provider between parties to the trade. It may also be sent as a copy from the instructing party and/or executing party to their respective custodians, to provide settlement information where an agreement to this effect exists.
This message must not be sent by an ETC service provider to a custodian.

Validation.Comment: Continuation Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T97):

Code.Name: LAST
Code.Description: Last page of a multi-parts confirmation with more than one page.

Code.Name: MORE
Code.Description: Intermediate page of a multi-parts confirmation which contains additional pages.

Code.Name: ONLY
Code.Description: Only page of the confirmation.

Validation.Comment: Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
Function must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T86):

Code.Name: CANC
Code.Description: Message requesting the cancellation of a previously sent message.

Code.Name: NEWM
Code.Description: New message.

Code.Name: PREA
Code.Description: Pre-advice the invoice of the trade at trade date. The pre-advice is not binding for settlement.

Validation.Comment: When present, Sub-function must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T85):

Code.Name: CODU
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes and the message is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Code.Name: COPY
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes.

Code.Name: DUPL
Code.Description: Message is for information/confirmation purposes. It is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50).
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38).
UTC Indicator must be a valid time expressed as HH[MM] (Error code(s): T39) .
Sign must not be used when UTC Indicator is equal to all zeroes (Error code(s): T14) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: BASK
Code.Description: Transaction is a single order to buy and sell several financial instruments for the purpose of simultaneous buying and selling. Baskets are often used for a set of 15 or more financial instruments and play a role in arbitrage activity.

Code.Name: EMTR
Code.Description: Transaction relates to employee trade reporting.

Code.Name: INDX
Code.Description: Transaction is a single order to buy or sell all underlying financial instruments of an index, for example, S&P500.

Code.Name: LIST
Code.Description: Transaction is a trade of a predetermined set of financial instruments.

Code.Name: PALL
Code.Description: Transaction is a pre-allocation.

Code.Name: PROG
Code.Description: Transaction relates to computer-driven automatically executed trades in large volumes of a set of several financial instruments.

Code.Name: TRAD
Code.Description: Transaction is a regular trade.

Validation.Comment: Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).

Validation.Qualifiers: ALMR, BASK, BMRB, COLR, COMM, INDX, ISSU, LIST, MAST, PREV, PROG, RELA, TRRF
Validation.Comment: Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).

Qualifier.Name: PAFI
Qualifier.Description: Quantity of Financial Instrument Partially Filled

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, that is, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, for example, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: In option A, Percentage Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points below par, for example, a discount price of 2.0% equals a price of 98 when par is 100.

Code.Name: PRCT
Code.Description: Price expressed as a percentage of par.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points above par, for example, a premium price of 2.0% equals a price of 102 when par is 100.

Code.Name: YIEL
Code.Description: Price expressed as a yield.

Validation.Comment: In option B, Amount Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: ACTU
Code.Description: Price expressed as an amount of currency per unit or per share.

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as a discount amount.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as a premium.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).
If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is PRIC, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: AVER
Code.Description: Price is an average execution price.

Code.Name: AVOV
Code.Description: Price is an override of the average price.

Code.Name: COMB
Code.Description: Price is a combined expenses price (used in the UK market).

Code.Name: GREX
Code.Description: Price is an all inclusive price, ie, including all charges, fees and taxes.

Code.Name: NET1
Code.Description: Price is a net price, ie, net of all charges, taxes, or fees.

Code.Name: NET2
Code.Description: Price is a net price, ie, net only of local broker's commission, local fees, or local taxes.

Code.Name: PARV
Code.Description: Price is a par value or equal to the nominal or face value of the instrument.

Code.Name: RDAV
Code.Description: Price is a rounded average price.

Code.Name: EXCH

Code.Name: TRRE

Code.Name: NOGE
Code.DetailedName: Not Instruction Generation by ETC Provider
Code.Description: Specifies if the ETC service provider is not to generate a settlement instruction where a previous agreement to do so exists.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is TTCO, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: BCBL
Code.Description: Trade is to be executed on board lots; not set for odd lots (UK specific).

Code.Name: BCBN
Code.Description: Trade is to be executed on bad names, not set for good names (UK specific).

Code.Name: BCFD
Code.Description: Not for foreign registration when unset (UK specific).

Code.Name: BCPD
Code.Description: In country of incorporation when unset (UK specific).

Code.Name: BCRO
Code.Description: Result of option when set (UK specific).

Code.Name: BCRP
Code.Description: Result of repo when set (UK specific).

Code.Name: BLKO
Code.Description: Trade is a block trade, allocation instructions will follow.

Code.Name: BTEX
Code.Description: Trade was executed at best execution.

Code.Name: BTMI
Code.Description: Bought minus indicator.

Code.Name: CALL
Code.Description: Trade executed following the exercise of a call option on the security.

Code.Name: CBNS
Code.Description: Trade is executed cum bonus.

Code.Name: CCPN
Code.Description: Trade is executed cum coupon.

Code.Name: CDIV
Code.Description: Trade is executed cum dividend.

Code.Name: CLBR
Code.Description: Trade executed for closure of a previous position before the rollover of a position (Deferred Settlement Service).

Code.Name: CLEN
Code.Description: Trade is to be executed clean, ie, does not pay government tax on the accrued interest on the bond, and consequently price is higher.

Code.Name: CRST
Code.Description: Cross trades are allowed whereby buy and sell orders are offset without recording the trade on the exchange.

Code.Name: CRTS
Code.Description: Trade is executed cum rights.

Code.Name: CWAR
Code.Description: Trade is executed cum warrants.

Code.Name: DIOR
Code.Description: Trade is executed with a specific trading party.

Code.Name: DIRT
Code.Description: Trade is executed dirty, ie, pay government tax on the accrued interest of the bond.

Code.Name: DORD
Code.Description: Trade is executed by a trading party other than the trading party to which the order is sent. In this case, the instructing party has traded with another broker which will subsequently send an advice of execution to the executing party.

Code.Name: FORW
Code.Description: Trade is based on forward price. Price was calculated after the close of the dealing period.

Code.Name: FRAC
Code.Description: Fractional parts allowed.

Code.Name: GTDL
Code.Description: Delivery of the financial instrument on settlement date is guaranteed.

Code.Name: HIST
Code.Description: Trade is based on historic price.

Code.Name: MAPR
Code.Description: The trade was executed at market price.

Code.Name: MONT
Code.Description: Trade executed for month-end settlement (Deferred Settlement Service).

Code.Name: NBFR
Code.Description: Trade executed for a new trade position on the next month following the rollover of a position (Deferred Settlement Service).

Code.Name: NCRS
Code.Description: No cross trade allowed.

Code.Name: NEGO
Code.Description: A negotiated trade is a trade for which the price is not the one quoted but an improved one that is, negotiated price.

Code.Name: NMPR
Code.Description: The trade was executed outside of normal market conditions (eg, in the case of an iceberg order).

Code.Name: PETA
Code.Description: Allows trader to explicitly request anonymity or disclosure in pre-trade market data feeds. Anonymity is relevant in markets where counterparties are regularly disclosed in order depth feeds. Disclosure is relevant when counterparties are not normally visible.

Code.Name: PUTT
Code.Description: Trade executed following the exercise of a put option on the security.

Code.Name: SETI
Code.Description: Trade is exempt from short-sale rules.

Code.Name: SPCU
Code.Description: Trade is executed with a special cum dividend, i.e., buying after the ex date and getting the dividend.

Code.Name: SPEX
Code.Description: Trade is executed with a special ex dividend, i.e., selling before the ex date without the coupon.

Code.Name: SPSI
Code.Description: Sold plus indication.

Code.Name: SSTI
Code.Description: Sold short indication.

Code.Name: TEFR
Code.Description: Trade executed this month following the rollover of positions.

Code.Name: TRFR
Code.Description: Trade executed on the next month following the rollover of positions.

Code.Name: XBNS
Code.Description: Trade is executed ex bonus.

Code.Name: XCPN
Code.Description: Trade is executed ex coupon.

Code.Name: XDIV
Code.Description: Trade is executed ex dividend.

Code.Name: XRTS
Code.Description: Trade is executed ex rights.

Code.Name: XWAR
Code.Description: Trade is executed ex warrants.

Code.Description: Party is acting as an agent for some executions and principal for others.

Code.Name: PRIN
Code.Description: Party is trading for his own account.

Code.Name: RISP
Code.Description: Party is trading as a riskless principal, that is, the order to buy (sell) has been simultaneously offset by an order to sell (buy) with another party.

Code.Name: RMKT
Code.Description: A regulated market is a market on which financial instruments can be traded according to rules defined by the stock exchange.

Code.Name: SINT
Code.Description: Firms which, on an organised, frequent and systematic basis deal on their own account by executing client orders outside a regulated market or an MTF. SIs have the obligation to provide, and make public, a definite bid and offer quote for liquid securities.

Code.Name: TAGT
Code.Description: The party appointed by the Fund Management Company. It updates records of investor accounts to reflect the daily investor purchases, redemptions, switches, transfers, and re-registrations. It ensures the timely settlement of transactions, and may provide tax information to the investor and/or to its intermediaries. It may calculate, collect, and rebate commissions. It prepares and distributes confirmations reflecting transactions, resulting in unit or cash account movements to the investor or the investor's intermediary. It responds to inquiries concerning account status, and processes the income distribution.

Code.Name: PROF

Code.Name: RETL

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present, and Qualifier is MICO, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year, divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year, divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014.See Narrative.

Code.Name: COLI

Code.Name: ETFT

Code.Name: FCTA

Code.Name: INSP

Code.Name: ISSU

Code.Name: MKDW
Code.Description: Relates to the decrease of positions held by an ICSD at the common depository due to custody operations (repurchase, pre-release, proceed of corp. event realigned).

Code.Name: MKUP
Code.Description: Relates to the increase of positions held by an ICSD at the common depository due to custody operations (repurchase, pre-release, proceed of corporate event realigned).

Code.Name: NETT
Code.Description: Relates to the netting of settlement instructions.

Code.Name: NSYN
Code.Description: Relates to the issue of medium and short term paper (CP, CD, MTN, notes...) under a program and without syndication arrangement.

Code.Name: OWNE
Code.Description: Relates to an account transfer involving more than one instructing party (messages sender) and/or account servicer (messages receiver).

Code.Name: OWNI
Code.Description: Relates to an account transfer involving one instructing party (messages sender) at one account servicer (messages receiver).

Code.Name: PAIR
Code.Description: Relates to a pair-off: the transaction is paired off and netted against one or more previous transactions.

Code.Name: PLAC
Code.Description: Relates to the placement/new issue of a financial instrument.

Code.Name: PORT
Code.Description: Relates to a portfolio move from one investment manager to another and/or from an account servicer to another. It is generally charged differently than another account transfer (OWNE, OWNI, INSP), hence the need to identify this type of transfer as such.

Code.Name: REAL
Code.Description: Relates to a realignment of positions.

Code.Name: REDI

Code.Name: REDM

Code.Name: RELE

Code.Name: REPU

Code.Name: RODE

Code.Name: RVPO

Code.Name: SBBK
Code.Description: Relates to a sell buy back transaction.

Code.Name: SECB

Code.Name: SECL

Code.Name: SUBS

Code.Name: SYND

Code.Name: TBAC

Code.Name: TRAD

Code.Name: TRVO

Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38).
If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is MICO, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year, divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year, divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014.See Narrative.

fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence C, if field :22H::BUSE//SWIT is present, then field :20C::PREV must be present in minimum one occurrence of subsequence A1 Linkages."

fieldvalidation.name: C8
fieldvalidation.comment: C8 If field :22F::DBNM//VEND is present in sequence D, then a vendor must be specified; i.e. one occurrence of sequence E must contain field :95a::VEND (Error code(s): D71).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If field :22F::DBNM//VEND is present in sequence D, then a vendor must be specified; i.e. one occurrence of sequence E must contain field :95a::VEND. If the Data Source Scheme is present in field :22F::DBNM//VEND then the conditional rule does not apply."

fieldvalidation.name: C9
fieldvalidation.comment: C9 In sequence E, if field :95a::EXCH Stock Exchange or :95a::TRRE Trade Regulator is present, then field :97a:: is not allowed in the same sequence (Error code(s): E63)
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence E, if field :95a::EXCH Stock Exchange or :95a::TRRE Trade Regulator is present, then field :97a:: is not allowed in the same sequence."

fieldvalidation.name: C10
fieldvalidation.comment: If either Deal Price (field 90a::DEAL) or Original Ordered Quantity (field :36B::ORDR) (in sequence C), or Settlement Amount (field :19A::SETT) (in subsequence D3) are present more than once, then in sequence C Buy/Sell Indicator (field :22H::BUSE) must be present with Indicator code FPOO or IPOO or IPPO (Error code(s): E75).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If either Deal Price (field 90a::DEAL) or Original Ordered Quantity (field :36B::ORDR) (in sequence C), or Settlement Amount (field :19A::SETT) (in subsequence D3) are present more than once, then in sequence C Buy/Sell Indicator (field :22H::BUSE) must be present with Indicator code FPOO or IPOO or IPPO (Error code(s): E75)."

fieldvalidation.name: FC-35B-A

fieldvalidation.name: FC-22a-A
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In field 22a of sequence C, if Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is PRIR, Indicator must contain a numerical value in the range 0001 - 9999 where 0001 refers to the highest priority."

fieldvalidation.name: FC2-35B-A
fieldvalidation.comment: FC2-35B-A ISIN is used at the beginning of Identification of Security (Subfield 1) and must be composed of uppercase letters only (Error code(s): T12).

fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";

fieldvalidation.name: FB-22F-A
fieldvalidation.comment: FB-22F-A If Qualifier is MPLE and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain a numerical value in the range 0001 - 9999.
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If Qualifier is MPLE and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain a numerical value in the range 0001 - 9999."
